intro: Heliconia sarapiquensis, commonly known as the Sarapiquí heliconia, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Heliconiaceae family and is characterized by its large, colorful inflorescences that resemble a spiral. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional basket weaving. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds, due to their bright colors and nectar-rich structure. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
